Title: Throughput and energy efficiency for S-FFR in massive MIMO enabled heterogeneous C-RAN
Source: IEEE Glob. Commun. Conf., GLOBECOM - Proc.
Abstract: © 2016 IEEE.This paper considers the massive multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) enabled heterogeneous cloud radio access network (C-RAN), in which both remote radio heads (RRHs) and massive MIMO macrocell base stations (BS) are deployed to potentially accomplish high throughput and energy efficiency (EE). In this network, the soft fractional frequency reuse (S-FFR) is employed to mitigate the inter-tier interference. We develop a tractable analytical approach to evaluate the throughput and EE of the entire network, which can well predict the impacts of the key system parameters such as number of macrocell BS antennas, RRH density, and S-FFR factor, etc. Our results demonstrate that massive MIMO is still a powerful tool for improving the throughput of the heterogeneous C-RAN while RRHs are capable of achieving higher EE. The impact of S-FFR on the network throughput is dependent on the density of RRHs. Furthermore, more radio resources allocated to the RRHs can greatly improve the EE of the network.
